bwwExcerpt: "That sense of excitement being brought to a pitch and then slammed back down is a hallmark of A Beautiful Noise in general. It’s so heavily focused on Neil Diamond being unhappy – the structure implies a detective story, solving the mystery of “why,” but despite a momentum-killing speech in the second act, psychological insight is thin on the ground – that the show seems to delight in denying us the surging, anthemic catharsis that’s a key part of the mix that makes those songs so beloved and m
